intro: Dimeria fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered dimeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Dimeria fasciculata is often found growing on rocky outcrops and sandy soils, making it a hardy and resilient species.
